intro.text: Welcome to the official IMS Software documentation portal. IMS offers robust workflow automation and management tools designed for enterprise environments.

sections.title: Chapter 1: Installation and Setup
sections.summary: Learn how to install IMS Software, configure initial settings, and prepare your environment for optimal performance.

content.text: IMS requires Windows 10 or later, 8GB of RAM minimum, 50GB of disk space, and .NET Framework 4.8 or higher. Download the latest installer from our website and run it with Administrator privileges.
During setup, choose between Typical or Custom installation modes. Custom mode lets you configure database connections and network settings.

items: Ensure SQL Server 2019 or higher is installed and reachable.
Configure Windows Firewall to allow IMS traffic on port 8080.
Create an administrator account for IMS management.

content.text: If installation fails, review logs found in %APPDATA%\IMS\logs\install.log to diagnose issues.
Common errors involve missing prerequisites or permission issues. Run installer as Administrator for best results.
Configure IMS either via the Setup Wizard or by editing the config file at C:\ProgramData\IMS\config.json.
Restart the IMS service after configuration changes to apply settings.

sections.title: Chapter 2: User Management and Roles
sections.summary: Manage users, define roles, and set permissions effectively with IMS User Management tools.

content.text: IMS supports role-based access control (RBAC) allowing you to assign granular permissions to users based on their role.
Predefined roles include Admin, Manager, and Viewer. Custom roles can be created for specific access needs.

items: Click 'Add User' and fill out the form.

rows: Manage users, settings, and system data.

content.text: RBAC ensures users only access what they're authorized for by grouping permissions into roles.
